1→;;;; sequences.lisp - ANSI Common Lisp sequence generic functions
     2→;;;;
     3→;;;; Feature: 001-ansi-sequence-functions (Phase 15B)
     4→;;;; Purpose: Implement ANSI CL sequence generic functions for Clysm compiler
     5→;;;;
     6→;;;; Functions implemented:
     7→;;;;   Counting: count, count-if, count-if-not
     8→;;;;   Search: find, find-if, find-if-not, position, position-if, position-if-not
     9→;;;;   Comparison: mismatch, search
    10→;;;;   Substitution: substitute, substitute-if, substitute-if-not,
    11→;;;;                 nsubstitute, nsubstitute-if, nsubstitute-if-not
    12→;;;;   Duplicates: remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates
    13→;;;;   Modification: fill, replace
    14→;;;;
    15→;;;; HyperSpec references:
    16→;;;;   [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
    17→;;;;   [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
    18→;;;;   [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
    19→;;;;   [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
    20→;;;;   [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
    21→;;;;   [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
    22→;;;;   [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
    23→;;;;   [fill](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_fill.htm)
    24→;;;;   [replace](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_replac.htm)
    25→;;;;
    26→;;;; All functions use *-suffix naming convention to avoid shadowing SBCL builtins.
    27→
    28→(in-package #:clysm)
    29→
    30→;;; ============================================================
    31→;;; Counting Functions
    32→;;; [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
    33→;;; ============================================================
    34→
    35→;; [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
    36→;; Returns the number of elements in sequence that satisfy the test.
    37→(defun count* (item sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
    38→                                  (start 0) end from-end)
    39→  "Count occurrences of ITEM in SEQUENCE.
    40→Returns the number of elements that satisfy (funcall test item (funcall key element)).
    41→Keyword arguments:
    42→  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
    43→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
    44→  :start - start index (default 0)
    45→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
    46→  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
    47→  (declare (ignore from-end))  ; from-end doesn't affect count
    48→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
    49→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
    50→         (real-start (car bounds))
    51→         (real-end (cdr bounds))
    52→         (count 0))
    53→    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
    54→          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
    55→          when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
    56→            do (incf count))
    57→    count))
    58→
    59→;; [count-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
    60→;; Returns the number of elements satisfying the predicate.
    61→(defun count-if* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
    62→                                          (start 0) end from-end)
    63→  "Count elements in SEQUENCE satisfying PREDICATE.
    64→Returns the number of elements where (funcall predicate (funcall key element)) is true.
    65→Keyword arguments:
    66→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
    67→  :start - start index (default 0)
    68→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
    69→  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
    70→  (declare (ignore from-end))
    71→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
    72→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
    73→         (real-start (car bounds))
    74→         (real-end (cdr bounds))
    75→         (count 0))
    76→    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
    77→          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
    78→          when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
    79→            do (incf count))
    80→    count))
    81→
    82→;; [count-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
    83→;; Returns the number of elements NOT satisfying the predicate.
    84→(defun count-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
    85→                                              (start 0) end from-end)
    86→  "Count elements in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
    87→Returns the number of elements where (funcall predicate (funcall key element)) is false.
    88→Keyword arguments:
    89→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
    90→  :start - start index (default 0)
    91→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
    92→  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
    93→  (declare (ignore from-end))
    94→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
    95→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
    96→         (real-start (car bounds))
    97→         (real-end (cdr bounds))
    98→         (count 0))
    99→    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   100→          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   101→          unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   102→            do (incf count))
   103→    count))
   104→
   105→;;; ============================================================
   106→;;; Search Functions
   107→;;; [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
   108→;;; [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
   109→;;; ============================================================
   110→
   111→;; [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
   112→;; Returns the first element satisfying the test.
   113→(defun find* (item sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   114→                                 (start 0) end from-end)
   115→  "Find ITEM in SEQUENCE.
   116→Returns the first element where (funcall test item (funcall key element)) is true.
   117→Returns NIL if no element matches.
   118→Keyword arguments:
   119→  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
   120→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   121→  :start - start index (default 0)
   122→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   123→  :from-end - if true, search from end and return last matching element"
   124→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   125→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   126→         (real-start (car bounds))
   127→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   128→    (if from-end
   129→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   130→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   131→              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
   132→                return elt)
   133→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   134→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   135→              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
   136→                return elt))))
   137→
   138→;; [find-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
   139→;; Returns the first element satisfying the predicate.
   140→(defun find-if* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   141→                                         (start 0) end from-end)
   142→  "Find first element in SEQUENCE satisfying PREDICATE.
   143→Returns the element, or NIL if no element satisfies.
   144→Keyword arguments:
   145→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   146→  :start - start index (default 0)
   147→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   148→  :from-end - if true, return last satisfying element"
   149→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   150→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   151→         (real-start (car bounds))
   152→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   153→    (if from-end
   154→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   155→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   156→              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   157→                return elt)
   158→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   159→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   160→              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   161→                return elt))))
   162→
   163→;; [find-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
   164→;; Returns the first element NOT satisfying the predicate.
   165→(defun find-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   166→                                             (start 0) end from-end)
   167→  "Find first element in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
   168→Returns the element, or NIL if all elements satisfy.
   169→Keyword arguments:
   170→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   171→  :start - start index (default 0)
   172→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   173→  :from-end - if true, return last non-satisfying element"
   174→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   175→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   176→         (real-start (car bounds))
   177→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   178→    (if from-end
   179→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   180→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   181→              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   182→                return elt)
   183→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   184→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   185→              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   186→                return elt))))
   187→
   188→;; [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
   189→;; Returns the index of the first matching element.
   190→(defun position* (item sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   191→                                     (start 0) end from-end)
   192→  "Find position of ITEM in SEQUENCE.
   193→Returns the index of the first element satisfying the test, or NIL if not found.
   194→Keyword arguments:
   195→  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
   196→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   197→  :start - start index (default 0)
   198→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   199→  :from-end - if true, return index of last matching element"
   200→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   201→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   202→         (real-start (car bounds))
   203→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   204→    (if from-end
   205→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   206→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   207→              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
   208→                return i)
   209→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   210→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   211→              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
   212→                return i))))
   213→
   214→;; [position-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
   215→;; Returns the index of the first element satisfying the predicate.
   216→(defun position-if* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   217→                                             (start 0) end from-end)
   218→  "Find position of first element in SEQUENCE satisfying PREDICATE.
   219→Returns the index, or NIL if no element satisfies.
   220→Keyword arguments:
   221→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   222→  :start - start index (default 0)
   223→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   224→  :from-end - if true, return index of last satisfying element"
   225→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   226→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   227→         (real-start (car bounds))
   228→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   229→    (if from-end
   230→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   231→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   232→              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   233→                return i)
   234→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   235→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   236→              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   237→                return i))))
   238→
   239→;; [position-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
   240→;; Returns the index of the first element NOT satisfying the predicate.
   241→(defun position-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   242→                                                 (start 0) end from-end)
   243→  "Find position of first element in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
   244→Returns the index, or NIL if all elements satisfy.
   245→Keyword arguments:
   246→  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
   247→  :start - start index (default 0)
   248→  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
   249→  :from-end - if true, return index of last non-satisfying element"
   250→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   251→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   252→         (real-start (car bounds))
   253→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   254→    (if from-end
   255→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   256→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   257→              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   258→                return i)
   259→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   260→              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   261→              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
   262→                return i))))
   263→
   264→;;; ============================================================
   265→;;; Comparison Functions
   266→;;; [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
   267→;;; [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
   268→;;; ============================================================
   269→
   270→;; [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
   271→;; Returns the index where two sequences first differ.
   272→(defun mismatch* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   273→                                           (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2
   274→                                           from-end)
   275→  "Compare SEQUENCE1 and SEQUENCE2, return index of first mismatch or NIL if equal.
   276→Keyword arguments:
   277→  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
   278→  :key   - key function (default #'identity)
   279→  :start1, :end1 - bounds for sequence1
   280→  :start2, :end2 - bounds for sequence2
   281→  :from-end - if true, compare from end"
   282→  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
   283→         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
   284→    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
   285→        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
   286→      (let ((range1 (- e1 s1))
   287→            (range2 (- e2 s2)))
   288→        (if from-end
   289→            ;; Compare from end
   290→            (loop for offset from 1 to (min range1 range2)
   291→                  for i1 = (- e1 offset)
   292→                  for i2 = (- e2 offset)
   293→                  for elt1 = (%sequence-ref sequence1 i1)
   294→                  for elt2 = (%sequence-ref sequence2 i2)
   295→                  unless (funcall test (funcall key elt1) (funcall key elt2))
   296→                    return (1+ i1)
   297→                  finally (return (if (= range1 range2) nil (+ s1 (min range1 range2)))))
   298→            ;; Compare from start
   299→            (loop for i from 0 below (min range1 range2)
   300→                  for i1 = (+ s1 i)
   301→                  for i2 = (+ s2 i)
   302→                  for elt1 = (%sequence-ref sequence1 i1)
   303→                  for elt2 = (%sequence-ref sequence2 i2)
   304→                  unless (funcall test (funcall key elt1) (funcall key elt2))
   305→                    return i1
   306→                  finally (return (if (= range1 range2) nil i1))))))))
   307→
   308→;; [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
   309→;; Searches for a subsequence within a sequence.
   310→(defun search* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   311→                                         (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2
   312→                                         from-end)
   313→  "Search for SEQUENCE1 as a subsequence of SEQUENCE2.
   314→Returns the index in SEQUENCE2 where SEQUENCE1 begins, or NIL if not found.
   315→Keyword arguments:
   316→  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
   317→  :key   - key function (default #'identity)
   318→  :start1, :end1 - bounds for sequence1 (the needle)
   319→  :start2, :end2 - bounds for sequence2 (the haystack)
   320→  :from-end - if true, return rightmost match"
   321→  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
   322→         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
   323→    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
   324→        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
   325→      (let* ((needle-len (- e1 s1))
   326→             (haystack-len (- e2 s2))
   327→             (result nil))
   328→        (when (<= needle-len haystack-len)
   329→          (if from-end
   330→              ;; Search from end
   331→              (loop for i from (- e2 needle-len) downto s2
   332→                    when (loop for j from 0 below needle-len
   333→                               for n-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence1 (+ s1 j))
   334→                               for h-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ i j))
   335→                               always (funcall test (funcall key n-elt)
   336→                                               (funcall key h-elt)))
   337→                      return (setf result i))
   338→              ;; Search from start
   339→              (loop for i from s2 to (- e2 needle-len)
   340→                    when (loop for j from 0 below needle-len
   341→                               for n-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence1 (+ s1 j))
   342→                               for h-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ i j))
   343→                               always (funcall test (funcall key n-elt)
   344→                                               (funcall key h-elt)))
   345→                      return (setf result i))))
   346→        result))))
   347→
   348→;;; ============================================================
   349→;;; Substitution Functions
   350→;;; [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   351→;;; ============================================================
   352→
   353→;; Internal helper for substitute/nsubstitute
   354→(defun %substitute-impl (newitem test-fn sequence copy-p
   355→                         &key (start 0) end from-end count (key #'identity))
   356→  "Internal implementation for substitute operations.
   357→TEST-FN is a function (element) -> boolean.
   358→If COPY-P is true, returns a new sequence; otherwise modifies in place."
   359→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   360→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   361→         (real-start (car bounds))
   362→         (real-end (cdr bounds))
   363→         (result (if copy-p (%copy-sequence sequence) sequence))
   364→         (replaced 0)
   365→         (max-replacements (or count most-positive-fixnum)))
   366→    (if from-end
   367→        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   368→              for elt = (%sequence-ref result i)
   369→              when (and (< replaced max-replacements)
   370→                        (funcall test-fn (funcall key elt)))
   371→                do (progn
   372→                     (%sequence-set result i newitem)
   373→                     (incf replaced)))
   374→        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   375→              for elt = (%sequence-ref result i)
   376→              when (and (< replaced max-replacements)
   377→                        (funcall test-fn (funcall key elt)))
   378→                do (progn
   379→                     (%sequence-set result i newitem)
   380→                     (incf replaced))))
   381→    result))
   382→
   383→;; [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   384→(defun substitute* (newitem olditem sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   385→                                                  (start 0) end from-end count)
   386→  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with OLDITEM replaced by NEWITEM."
   387→  (%substitute-impl newitem
   388→                    (lambda (elt) (funcall test olditem elt))
   389→                    sequence t
   390→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   391→                    :count count :key key))
   392→
   393→;; [substitute-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   394→(defun substitute-if* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   395→                                                       (start 0) end from-end count)
   396→  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with elements satisfying PREDICATE replaced by NEWITEM."
   397→  (%substitute-impl newitem predicate sequence t
   398→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   399→                    :count count :key key))
   400→
   401→;; [substitute-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   402→(defun substitute-if-not* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   403→                                                           (start 0) end from-end count)
   404→  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with elements NOT satisfying PREDICATE replaced."
   405→  (%substitute-impl newitem
   406→                    (lambda (elt) (not (funcall predicate elt)))
   407→                    sequence t
   408→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   409→                    :count count :key key))
   410→
   411→;; [nsubstitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   412→(defun nsubstitute* (newitem olditem sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   413→                                                   (start 0) end from-end count)
   414→  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing OLDITEM with NEWITEM."
   415→  (%substitute-impl newitem
   416→                    (lambda (elt) (funcall test olditem elt))
   417→                    sequence nil
   418→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   419→                    :count count :key key))
   420→
   421→;; [nsubstitute-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   422→(defun nsubstitute-if* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   423→                                                        (start 0) end from-end count)
   424→  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing elements satisfying PREDICATE."
   425→  (%substitute-impl newitem predicate sequence nil
   426→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   427→                    :count count :key key))
   428→
   429→;; [nsubstitute-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
   430→(defun nsubstitute-if-not* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
   431→                                                            (start 0) end from-end count)
   432→  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing elements NOT satisfying PREDICATE."
   433→  (%substitute-impl newitem
   434→                    (lambda (elt) (not (funcall predicate elt)))
   435→                    sequence nil
   436→                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
   437→                    :count count :key key))
   438→
   439→;;; ============================================================
   440→;;; Duplicate Removal Functions
   441→;;; [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
   442→;;; ============================================================
   443→
   444→;; [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
   445→(defun remove-duplicates* (sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   446→                                         (start 0) end from-end)
   447→  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with duplicate elements removed.
   448→By default, later occurrences are kept (earlier ones removed).
   449→With :from-end t, earlier occurrences are kept."
   450→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   451→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   452→         (real-start (car bounds))
   453→         (real-end (cdr bounds))
   454→         (seq-type (%sequence-type sequence)))
   455→    ;; Collect non-duplicate elements based on from-end
   456→    (let ((result-elements nil)
   457→          (seen nil))
   458→      (if from-end
   459→          ;; Keep first occurrences - scan forward, collect if not seen
   460→          (progn
   461→            (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   462→                  for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   463→                  for key-val = (funcall key elt)
   464→                  unless (cl:member key-val seen :test test)
   465→                    do (push elt result-elements)
   466→                       (push key-val seen))
   467→            (setf result-elements (nreverse result-elements)))
   468→          ;; Keep last occurrences - scan backward, collect if not seen, then reverse
   469→          (progn
   470→            (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
   471→                  for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
   472→                  for key-val = (funcall key elt)
   473→                  unless (cl:member key-val seen :test test)
   474→                    do (push elt result-elements)
   475→                       (push key-val seen))))
   476→      ;; Prepend elements before start, append elements after end
   477→      (let ((before-elements (loop for i from 0 below real-start
   478→                                   collect (%sequence-ref sequence i)))
   479→            (after-elements (loop for i from real-end below len
   480→                                  collect (%sequence-ref sequence i))))
   481→        (setf result-elements (append before-elements result-elements after-elements)))
   482→      ;; Convert to appropriate type
   483→      (ecase seq-type
   484→        (list result-elements)
   485→        (vector (coerce result-elements 'vector))
   486→        (string (coerce result-elements 'string))))))
   487→
   488→;; [delete-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
   489→;; Note: For simplicity, this implementation copies like remove-duplicates*
   490→;; A truly destructive version would modify the sequence in place
   491→(defun delete-duplicates* (sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
   492→                                         (start 0) end from-end)
   493→  "Destructively remove duplicate elements from SEQUENCE.
   494→May modify the original sequence."
   495→  ;; For vectors and strings, we return the result of remove-duplicates*
   496→  ;; For lists, we could do in-place, but for simplicity we'll just copy
   497→  (remove-duplicates* sequence :test test :key key :start start :end end :from-end from-end))
   498→
   499→;;; ============================================================
   500→;;; Modification Functions
   501→;;; [fill](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_fill.htm)
   502→;;; [replace](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_replac.htm)
   503→;;; ============================================================
   504→
   505→;; [fill](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_fill.htm)
   506→(defun fill* (sequence item &key (start 0) end)
   507→  "Destructively fill SEQUENCE with ITEM.
   508→Returns the modified sequence."
   509→  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
   510→         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
   511→         (real-start (car bounds))
   512→         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
   513→    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
   514→          do (%sequence-set sequence i item))
   515→    sequence))
   516→
   517→;; [replace](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_replac.htm)
   518→(defun replace* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2)
   519→  "Destructively copy elements from SEQUENCE2 into SEQUENCE1.
   520→Returns the modified SEQUENCE1."
   521→  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
   522→         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
   523→    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
   524→        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
   525→      (let ((copy-count (min (- e1 s1) (- e2 s2))))
   526→        ;; Handle overlapping sequences: if s1 < s2, copy forward; else backward
   527→        (if (and (eq sequence1 sequence2) (< s2 s1) (< s1 e2))
   528→            ;; Overlap: copy backward
   529→            (loop for i from (1- copy-count) downto 0
   530→                  do (%sequence-set sequence1 (+ s1 i)
   531→                                    (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ s2 i))))
   532→            ;; No overlap or safe: copy forward
   533→            (loop for i from 0 below copy-count
   534→                  do (%sequence-set sequence1 (+ s1 i)
   535→                                    (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ s2 i)))))))
   536→    sequence1))
   537→
   538→;;; ============================================================
   539→;;; End of sequences.lisp
   540→;;; ============================================================
   541→

;;;; sequences.lisp - ANSI Common Lisp sequence generic functions
;;;;
;;;; Feature: 001-ansi-sequence-functions (Phase 15B)
;;;; Purpose: Implement ANSI CL sequence generic functions for Clysm compiler
;;;;
;;;; Functions implemented:
;;;;   Counting: count, count-if, count-if-not
;;;;   Search: find, find-if, find-if-not, position, position-if, position-if-not
;;;;   Comparison: mismatch, search
;;;;   Substitution: substitute, substitute-if, substitute-if-not,
;;;;                 nsubstitute, nsubstitute-if, nsubstitute-if-not
;;;;   Duplicates: remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates
;;;;   Modification: fill, replace
;;;;
;;;; HyperSpec references:
;;;;   [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;;;;   [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
;;;;   [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
;;;;   [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
;;;;   [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
;;;;   [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
;;;;   [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Counting Functions
;;; [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;; Returns the number of elements in sequence that satisfy the test.
(defun count* (item sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                  (start 0) end from-end)
  "Count occurrences of ITEM in SEQUENCE.
Returns the number of elements that satisfy (funcall test item (funcall key element)).
Keyword arguments:
  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
  (declare (ignore from-end))  ; from-end doesn't affect count
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds))
         (count 0))
    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
          when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
            do (incf count))
    count))

;; [count-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;; Returns the number of elements satisfying the predicate.
(defun count-if* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                          (start 0) end from-end)
  "Count elements in SEQUENCE satisfying PREDICATE.
Returns the number of elements where (funcall predicate (funcall key element)) is true.
Keyword arguments:
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
  (declare (ignore from-end))
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds))
         (count 0))
    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
          when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
            do (incf count))
    count))

;; [count-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;; Returns the number of elements NOT satisfying the predicate.
(defun count-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                              (start 0) end from-end)
  "Count elements in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
Returns the number of elements where (funcall predicate (funcall key element)) is false.
Keyword arguments:
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, process from end (doesn't affect count result)"
  (declare (ignore from-end))
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds))
         (count 0))
    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
          for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
          unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
            do (incf count))
    count))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Search Functions
;;; [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
;;; [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
;; Returns the first element satisfying the test.
(defun find* (item sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                 (start 0) end from-end)
  "Find ITEM in SEQUENCE.
Returns the first element where (funcall test item (funcall key element)) is true.
Returns NIL if no element matches.
Keyword arguments:
  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, search from end and return last matching element"
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
    (if from-end
        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
                return elt)
        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              when (funcall test item (funcall key elt))
                return elt))))

;; [find-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
;; Returns the first element satisfying the predicate.
(defun find-if* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                         (start 0) end from-end)
  "Find first element in SEQUENCE satisfying PREDICATE.
Returns the element, or NIL if no element satisfies.
Keyword arguments:
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, return last satisfying element"
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
    (if from-end
        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
                return elt)
        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              when (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
                return elt))))

;; [find-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm)
;; Returns the first element NOT satisfying the predicate.
(defun find-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                             (start 0) end from-end)
  "Find first element in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
Returns the element, or NIL if all elements satisfy.
Keyword arguments:
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)
  :start - start index (default 0)
  :end   - end index (default NIL meaning end of sequence)
  :from-end - if true, return last non-satisfying element"
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))

         (real-start (car bounds))

        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
                return elt)
        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
              for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
              unless (funcall predicate (funcall key elt))
                return elt))))

(defun position-if-not* (predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)

  "Find position of first element in SEQUENCE NOT satisfying PREDICATE.
Returns the index, or NIL if all elements satisfy.
Keyword arguments:
  :key   - key function to extract comparison value (default #'identity)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Comparison Functions
;;; [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
;;; [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; [mismatch](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mismat.htm)
;; Returns the index where two sequences first differ.
(defun mismatch* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                           (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2
                                           from-end)
  "Compare SEQUENCE1 and SEQUENCE2, return index of first mismatch or NIL if equal.
Keyword arguments:
  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
  :key   - key function (default #'identity)
  :start1, :end1 - bounds for sequence1
  :start2, :end2 - bounds for sequence2
  :from-end - if true, compare from end"
  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
      (let ((range1 (- e1 s1))
            (range2 (- e2 s2)))
        (if from-end
            ;; Compare from end
            (loop for offset from 1 to (min range1 range2)
                  for i1 = (- e1 offset)
                  for i2 = (- e2 offset)
                  for elt1 = (%sequence-ref sequence1 i1)
                  for elt2 = (%sequence-ref sequence2 i2)
                  unless (funcall test (funcall key elt1) (funcall key elt2))
                    return (1+ i1)
                  finally (return (if (= range1 range2) nil (+ s1 (min range1 range2)))))
            ;; Compare from start
            (loop for i from 0 below (min range1 range2)
                  for i1 = (+ s1 i)
                  for i2 = (+ s2 i)
                  for elt1 = (%sequence-ref sequence1 i1)
                  for elt2 = (%sequence-ref sequence2 i2)
                  unless (funcall test (funcall key elt1) (funcall key elt2))
                    return i1
                  finally (return (if (= range1 range2) nil i1))))))))

;; [search](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_search.htm)
;; Searches for a subsequence within a sequence.
(defun search* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                         (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2
                                         from-end)
  "Search for SEQUENCE1 as a subsequence of SEQUENCE2.
Returns the index in SEQUENCE2 where SEQUENCE1 begins, or NIL if not found.
Keyword arguments:
  :test  - comparison function (default #'eql)
  :key   - key function (default #'identity)
  :start1, :end1 - bounds for sequence1 (the needle)
  :start2, :end2 - bounds for sequence2 (the haystack)
  :from-end - if true, return rightmost match"
  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
      (let* ((needle-len (- e1 s1))
             (haystack-len (- e2 s2))
             (result nil))
        (when (<= needle-len haystack-len)
          (if from-end
              ;; Search from end
              (loop for i from (- e2 needle-len) downto s2
                    when (loop for j from 0 below needle-len
                               for n-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence1 (+ s1 j))
                               for h-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ i j))
                               always (funcall test (funcall key n-elt)
                                               (funcall key h-elt)))
                      return (setf result i))
              ;; Search from start
              (loop for i from s2 to (- e2 needle-len)
                    when (loop for j from 0 below needle-len
                               for n-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence1 (+ s1 j))
                               for h-elt = (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ i j))
                               always (funcall test (funcall key n-elt)
                                               (funcall key h-elt)))
                      return (setf result i))))
        result))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Substitution Functions
;;; [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; Internal helper for substitute/nsubstitute
(defun %substitute-impl (newitem test-fn sequence copy-p
                         &key (start 0) end from-end count (key #'identity))
  "Internal implementation for substitute operations.
TEST-FN is a function (element) -> boolean.
If COPY-P is true, returns a new sequence; otherwise modifies in place."
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds))
         (result (if copy-p (%copy-sequence sequence) sequence))
         (replaced 0)
         (max-replacements (or count most-positive-fixnum)))
    (if from-end
        (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
              for elt = (%sequence-ref result i)
              when (and (< replaced max-replacements)
                        (funcall test-fn (funcall key elt)))
                do (progn
                     (%sequence-set result i newitem)
                     (incf replaced)))
        (loop for i from real-start below real-end
              for elt = (%sequence-ref result i)
              when (and (< replaced max-replacements)
                        (funcall test-fn (funcall key elt)))
                do (progn
                     (%sequence-set result i newitem)
                     (incf replaced))))
    result))

;; [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun substitute* (newitem olditem sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                                  (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with OLDITEM replaced by NEWITEM."
  (%substitute-impl newitem
                    (lambda (elt) (funcall test olditem elt))
                    sequence t
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;; [substitute-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun substitute-if* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                                       (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with elements satisfying PREDICATE replaced by NEWITEM."
  (%substitute-impl newitem predicate sequence t
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;; [substitute-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun substitute-if-not* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                                           (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with elements NOT satisfying PREDICATE replaced."
  (%substitute-impl newitem
                    (lambda (elt) (not (funcall predicate elt)))
                    sequence t
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;; [nsubstitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun nsubstitute* (newitem olditem sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                                   (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing OLDITEM with NEWITEM."
  (%substitute-impl newitem
                    (lambda (elt) (funcall test olditem elt))
                    sequence nil
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;; [nsubstitute-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun nsubstitute-if* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                                        (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing elements satisfying PREDICATE."
  (%substitute-impl newitem predicate sequence nil
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;; [nsubstitute-if-not](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_substc.htm)
(defun nsubstitute-if-not* (newitem predicate sequence &key (key #'identity)
                                                            (start 0) end from-end count)
  "Destructively modify SEQUENCE, replacing elements NOT satisfying PREDICATE."
  (%substitute-impl newitem
                    (lambda (elt) (not (funcall predicate elt)))
                    sequence nil
                    :start start :end end :from-end from-end
                    :count count :key key))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Duplicate Removal Functions
;;; [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; [remove-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
(defun remove-duplicates* (sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                         (start 0) end from-end)
  "Return a copy of SEQUENCE with duplicate elements removed.
By default, later occurrences are kept (earlier ones removed).
With :from-end t, earlier occurrences are kept."
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds))
         (seq-type (%sequence-type sequence)))
    ;; Collect non-duplicate elements based on from-end
    (let ((result-elements nil)
          (seen nil))
      (if from-end
          ;; Keep first occurrences - scan forward, collect if not seen
          (progn
            (loop for i from real-start below real-end
                  for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
                  for key-val = (funcall key elt)
                  unless (cl:member key-val seen :test test)
                    do (push elt result-elements)
                       (push key-val seen))
            (setf result-elements (nreverse result-elements)))
          ;; Keep last occurrences - scan backward, collect if not seen, then reverse
          (progn
            (loop for i from (1- real-end) downto real-start
                  for elt = (%sequence-ref sequence i)
                  for key-val = (funcall key elt)
                  unless (cl:member key-val seen :test test)
                    do (push elt result-elements)
                       (push key-val seen))))
      ;; Prepend elements before start, append elements after end
      (let ((before-elements (loop for i from 0 below real-start
                                   collect (%sequence-ref sequence i)))
            (after-elements (loop for i from real-end below len
                                  collect (%sequence-ref sequence i))))
        (setf result-elements (append before-elements result-elements after-elements)))
      ;; Convert to appropriate type
      (ecase seq-type
        (list result-elements)
        (vector (coerce result-elements 'vector))
        (string (coerce result-elements 'string))))))

;; [delete-duplicates](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_dup.htm)
;; Note: For simplicity, this implementation copies like remove-duplicates*
;; A truly destructive version would modify the sequence in place
(defun delete-duplicates* (sequence &key (test #'eql) (key #'identity)
                                         (start 0) end from-end)
  "Destructively remove duplicate elements from SEQUENCE.
May modify the original sequence."
  ;; For vectors and strings, we return the result of remove-duplicates*
  ;; For lists, we could do in-place, but for simplicity we'll just copy
  (remove-duplicates* sequence :test test :key key :start start :end end :from-end from-end))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Modification Functions
;;; [fill](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_fill.htm)
;;; [replace](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_replac.htm)
;;; ============================================================

;; [fill](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_fill.htm)
(defun fill* (sequence item &key (start 0) end)
  "Destructively fill SEQUENCE with ITEM.
Returns the modified sequence."
  (let* ((len (%sequence-length sequence))
         (bounds (validate-bounding-indices start end len))
         (real-start (car bounds))
         (real-end (cdr bounds)))
    (loop for i from real-start below real-end
          do (%sequence-set sequence i item))
    sequence))

;; [replace](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_replac.htm)
(defun replace* (sequence1 sequence2 &key (start1 0) end1 (start2 0) end2)
  "Destructively copy elements from SEQUENCE2 into SEQUENCE1.
Returns the modified SEQUENCE1."
  (let* ((len1 (%sequence-length sequence1))
         (len2 (%sequence-length sequence2)))
    (multiple-value-bind (s1 e1 s2 e2)
        (validate-two-sequence-bounds start1 end1 len1 start2 end2 len2)
      (let ((copy-count (min (- e1 s1) (- e2 s2))))
        ;; Handle overlapping sequences: if s1 < s2, copy forward; else backward
        (if (and (eq sequence1 sequence2) (< s2 s1) (< s1 e2))
            ;; Overlap: copy backward
            (loop for i from (1- copy-count) downto 0
                  do (%sequence-set sequence1 (+ s1 i)
                                    (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ s2 i))))
            ;; No overlap or safe: copy forward
            (loop for i from 0 below copy-count
                  do (%sequence-set sequence1 (+ s1 i)
                                    (%sequence-ref sequence2 (+ s2 i)))))))
    sequence1))

;;; ============================================================
;;; End of sequences.lisp
;;; ============================================================

content.thinking:
コンパイラに組み込まれている関数:- find, find-if
- position, position-if
- substitute, substitute-if
- count, count-if

組み込まれていない関数:- count-if-not- find-if-not
- position-if-not- mismatch- search- substitute-if-not
- nsubstitute, nsubstitute-if, nsubstitute-if-not
- remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates
- fill, replace

implementation-plan.mdのPhase 15Bの検証基準を確認:```markdown### Phase 15: シーケンス・コレクション強化 (ANSI-Sequences)
**目標**: シーケンス関連テスト準拠率 60%+#### 15B: シーケンス汎用関数```lisp;; 追加が必要
(count count-if count-if-not)
(position position-if position-if-not)(find find-if find-if-not)(remove-duplicates delete-duplicates)
(mismatch search)(substitute substitute-if nsubstitute nsubstitute-if)
(replace fill)
```

**タスク**:
- [ ] 検索関数 (count, position, find) 完全実装- [ ] 置換関数 (substitute, replace)
- [ ] 重複削除 (remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates)
- [ ] 比較関数 (mismatch, search)```

これを見ると、Phase 15Bでは以下が必要:
1. count, count-if, count-if-not - 検索関数2. position, position-if, position-if-not - 検索関数
3. find, find-if, find-if-not - 検索関数4. 

残りの関数群は重要な実装ターゲットとなる。置換、重複削除、比較関数の追加が求められており、特にnsubstitute、delete-duplicates、searchなどが未実装。ホスト側の実装は完了しているため、Wasmコンパイラへの組み込みが次の課題となる。これらの関数は、シーケンス操作の完全性を高めるために不可欠な要素となっている。

テスト適合率60%以上を目指すためには、段階的なアプローチが必要となるだろう。

現状、ホスト側の実装は21関数で完了しており、テストも存在する。しかし、Wasmコンパイル対応は8関数にとどまっており、残りの関数群の対応が課題となっている。

特に重点を置くべきは、検索、置換、重複削除、比較関数の完全実装だ。これらの関数群のWasmコンパイル対応を進めることで、プロジェクトの進捗を大きく前進させられる可能性がある。

     2→

     4→**Created**: 2025-12-31
     5→**Status**: Draft

     7→
     8→## User Scenarios & Testing *(mandatory)*
     9→
    10→### User Story 1 - Element Counting Functions (Priority: P1)
    11→
    12→A Common Lisp developer using the clysm compiler needs to count elements in sequences. They write code using `count`, `count-if`, and `count-if-not` to count occurrences in lists, vectors, and strings.
    13→
    14→**Why this priority**: Counting is a fundamental sequence operation used extensively in data processing. These functions form the basis for many higher-level operations.
    15→
    16→**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by calling count functions on various sequence types and verifying the returned count matches expected values.
    17→
    18→**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    19→
    20→1. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1 4)`, **When** calling `(count 1 list)`, **Then** returns `3`
    21→2. **Given** a vector `#(a b c b d b)`, **When** calling `(count 'b vector)`, **Then** returns `3`
    22→3. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(count #\l string)`, **Then** returns `2`
    23→4. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `2`
    24→5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if-not #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `3`
    25→6. **Given** a list `'((a 1) (b 2) (a 3))`, **When** calling `(count 'a list :key #'car)`, **Then** returns `2`
    26→7. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if #'evenp list :start 1 :end 4)`, **Then** returns `2` (counting 2, 4)
    27→
    28→---
    29→
    30→### User Story 2 - Element Search Functions (Priority: P1)
    31→
    32→A Common Lisp developer needs to find elements or their positions in sequences. They use `find`, `find-if`, `find-if-not`, `position`, `position-if`, and `position-if-not` to locate elements.
    33→
    34→**Why this priority**: Finding and positioning are essential for data lookup and manipulation. These functions enable conditional element access.
    35→
    36→**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by calling find/position functions and verifying correct element/index is returned or NIL when not found.
    37→
    38→**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    39→
    40→1. **Given** a list `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(find 'c list)`, **Then** returns `c`
    41→2. **Given** a list `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(find 'z list)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
    42→3. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(position 3 list)`, **Then** returns `2`
    43→4. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(find-if #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `2`
    44→5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(position-if-not #'oddp list)`, **Then** returns `1`
    45→6. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(position #\l string)`, **Then** returns `2`
    46→7. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 3 2 1)`, **When** calling `(position 3 list :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `4`
    47→8. **Given** a list `'("apple" "banana" "cherry")`, **When** calling `(find "banana" list :test #'string=)`, **Then** returns `"banana"`
    48→
    49→---
    50→
    51→### User Story 3 - Sequence Comparison Functions (Priority: P2)
    52→
    53→A Common Lisp developer needs to compare sequences to find differences or search for subsequences. They use `mismatch` and `search` for these operations.
    54→
    55→**Why this priority**: Comparison functions enable pattern matching and difference detection, which are important for text processing and data validation.
    56→
    57→**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by comparing sequences and verifying mismatch positions or search results.
    58→
    59→**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    60→
    61→1. **Given** sequences `"abcd"` and `"abXd"`, **When** calling `(mismatch seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `2`
    62→2. **Given** sequences `"abcd"` and `"abcd"`, **When** calling `(mismatch seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
    63→3. **Given** sequences `'(a b c)` and `'(a b c d e)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `0`
    64→4. **Given** sequences `'(b c)` and `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `1`
    65→5. **Given** sequences `'(x y)` and `'(a b c)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
    66→6. **Given** sequences `"bc"` and `"abcbc"`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2 :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `3`
    67→
    68→---
    69→
    70→### User Story 4 - Element Substitution Functions (Priority: P2)
    71→
    72→A Common Lisp developer needs to replace elements in sequences. They use `substitute`, `substitute-if`, `nsubstitute`, and `nsubstitute-if` for non-destructive and destructive replacements.
    73→
    74→**Why this priority**: Substitution enables data transformation, which is core to functional programming patterns.
    75→

    77→

    79→
    80→1. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list)`, **Then** returns `'(9 2 9 3 9)` and original list is unchanged
    81→2. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(substitute #\x #\l string)`, **Then** returns `"hexxo"`
    82→3. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(substitute-if 0 #'oddp list)`, **Then** returns `'(0 2 0 4)`
    83→4. **Given** a vector `#(1 2 1 3)`, **When** calling `(nsubstitute 9 1 vector)`, **Then** the original vector is modified to `#(9 2 9 3)`
    84→5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list :count 2)`, **Then** returns `'(9 2 9 3 1)` (only first 2 replaced)
    85→6. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list :from-end t :count 2)`, **Then** returns `'(1 2 9 3 9)` (last 2 replaced)
    86→
    87→---
    88→
    89→### User Story 5 - Duplicate Removal Functions (Priority: P2)
    90→
    91→A Common Lisp developer needs to remove duplicate elements from sequences. They use `remove-duplicates` and `delete-duplicates` for non-destructive and destructive operations.
    92→
    93→**Why this priority**: Duplicate removal is essential for data deduplication and set-like operations.
    94→

    96→

   100→2. **Given** a list `'(a b a c b d)`, **When** calling `(remove-duplicates list :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `'(a b c d)` (keeping first occurrences)

file.content:
# Feature Specification: ANSI Sequence Generic Functions (Phase 15B)

**Feature Branch**: `001-ansi-sequence-functions`
**Created**: 2025-12-31
**Status**: Draft
**Input**: User description: "Phase 15B: シーケンス汎用関数を実装する。目標はsequencesカテゴリANSIテスト準拠率60%+達成。count/count-if/count-if-not、position/position-if/position-if-not、find/find-if/find-if-not、remove-duplicates/delete-duplicates、mismatch/search、substitute/substitute-if/nsubstitute/nsubstitute-if、replace/fillを実装。:test, :key, :start, :end, :from-endキーワード引数を完全サポート。リスト・ベクタ・文字列の全シーケンス型に対応。"

## User Scenarios & Testing *(mandatory)*

### User Story 1 - Element Counting Functions (Priority: P1)

A Common Lisp developer using the clysm compiler needs to count elements in sequences. They write code using `count`, `count-if`, and `count-if-not` to count occurrences in lists, vectors, and strings.

**Why this priority**: Counting is a fundamental sequence operation used extensively in data processing. These functions form the basis for many higher-level operations.

**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by calling count functions on various sequence types and verifying the returned count matches expected values.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1 4)`, **When** calling `(count 1 list)`, **Then** returns `3`
2. **Given** a vector `#(a b c b d b)`, **When** calling `(count 'b vector)`, **Then** returns `3`
3. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(count #\l string)`, **Then** returns `2`
4. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `2`
5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if-not #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `3`
6. **Given** a list `'((a 1) (b 2) (a 3))`, **When** calling `(count 'a list :key #'car)`, **Then** returns `2`
7. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(count-if #'evenp list :start 1 :end 4)`, **Then** returns `2` (counting 2, 4)

---

### User Story 2 - Element Search Functions (Priority: P1)

A Common Lisp developer needs to find elements or their positions in sequences. They use `find`, `find-if`, `find-if-not`, `position`, `position-if`, and `position-if-not` to locate elements.

**Why this priority**: Finding and positioning are essential for data lookup and manipulation. These functions enable conditional element access.

**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by calling find/position functions and verifying correct element/index is returned or NIL when not found.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** a list `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(find 'c list)`, **Then** returns `c`
2. **Given** a list `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(find 'z list)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
3. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(position 3 list)`, **Then** returns `2`
4. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 5)`, **When** calling `(find-if #'evenp list)`, **Then** returns `2`
5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(position-if-not #'oddp list)`, **Then** returns `1`
6. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(position #\l string)`, **Then** returns `2`
7. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4 3 2 1)`, **When** calling `(position 3 list :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `4`
8. **Given** a list `'("apple" "banana" "cherry")`, **When** calling `(find "banana" list :test #'string=)`, **Then** returns `"banana"`

---

### User Story 3 - Sequence Comparison Functions (Priority: P2)

A Common Lisp developer needs to compare sequences to find differences or search for subsequences. They use `mismatch` and `search` for these operations.

**Why this priority**: Comparison functions enable pattern matching and difference detection, which are important for text processing and data validation.

**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by comparing sequences and verifying mismatch positions or search results.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** sequences `"abcd"` and `"abXd"`, **When** calling `(mismatch seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `2`
2. **Given** sequences `"abcd"` and `"abcd"`, **When** calling `(mismatch seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
3. **Given** sequences `'(a b c)` and `'(a b c d e)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `0`
4. **Given** sequences `'(b c)` and `'(a b c d)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `1`
5. **Given** sequences `'(x y)` and `'(a b c)`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2)`, **Then** returns `NIL`
6. **Given** sequences `"bc"` and `"abcbc"`, **When** calling `(search seq1 seq2 :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `3`

---

### User Story 4 - Element Substitution Functions (Priority: P2)

A Common Lisp developer needs to replace elements in sequences. They use `substitute`, `substitute-if`, `nsubstitute`, and `nsubstitute-if` for non-destructive and destructive replacements.

**Why this priority**: Substitution enables data transformation, which is core to functional programming patterns.

**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by substituting elements and verifying the resulting sequence contains correct replacements.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list)`, **Then** returns `'(9 2 9 3 9)` and original list is unchanged
2. **Given** a string `"hello"`, **When** calling `(substitute #\x #\l string)`, **Then** returns `"hexxo"`
3. **Given** a list `'(1 2 3 4)`, **When** calling `(substitute-if 0 #'oddp list)`, **Then** returns `'(0 2 0 4)`
4. **Given** a vector `#(1 2 1 3)`, **When** calling `(nsubstitute 9 1 vector)`, **Then** the original vector is modified to `#(9 2 9 3)`
5. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list :count 2)`, **Then** returns `'(9 2 9 3 1)` (only first 2 replaced)
6. **Given** a list `'(1 2 1 3 1)`, **When** calling `(substitute 9 1 list :from-end t :count 2)`, **Then** returns `'(1 2 9 3 9)` (last 2 replaced)

---

### User Story 5 - Duplicate Removal Functions (Priority: P2)

A Common Lisp developer needs to remove duplicate elements from sequences. They use `remove-duplicates` and `delete-duplicates` for non-destructive and destructive operations.

**Why this priority**: Duplicate removal is essential for data deduplication and set-like operations.

**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by removing duplicates and verifying the resulting sequence has unique elements.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** a list `'(a b a c b d)`, **When** calling `(remove-duplicates list)`, **Then** returns `'(a c b d)` (keeping last occurrences by default)
2. **Given** a list `'(a b a c b d)`, **When** calling `(remove-duplicates list :from-end t)`, **Then** returns `'(a b c d)` (keeping first occurrences)

テストはコンパイルエラーで失敗しています。ただし、重要なのは以下の情報です：

1. 1006個のコンパイル可能なフォームが収集された
2. 247個がコンパイル成功 (24.6%)
3. 759個が失敗

これはimplementation-plan.mdのPhase 13D（真のセルフホスティング）の目標に関連する情報です。

現在のブランチ（001-ansi-sequence-functions）のPhase 15Bの検証基準を確認します：

Phase 15Bのタスク：
- 検索関数 (count, position, find) 完全実装
- 置換関数 (substitute, replace)
- 重複削除 (remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates)
- 比較関数 (mismatch, search)

検証基準 (Phase 15全体):
- `(count 1 '(1 2 1 3 1))` => 3
- `(intersection '(1 2 3) '(2 3 4))` => (2 3) or (3 2)  ← Phase 15A
- `(remove-duplicates '(a b a c b))` => (A B C) or equivalent
- sequences カテゴリ 60%+ パス
- cons カテゴリ 50%+ パス

現在の実装状況を確認すると：
1. ホスト側実装（sequences.lisp）：21関数すべて実装済み
2. テストファイル：10個存在
3. Wasmコンパイル対応：一部の関数のみ（count, count-if, find, find-if, position, position-if, substitute, substitute-if）


4. tasks.mdとimplementation-plan.mdの更新が必要

tasks.mdとimplementation-plan.mdの内容が実際の実装状況と一致していないことが判明しました。すべての関数が既にsequences.lispに実装されているにもかかわらず、タスクリストは未チェックのままです。これは文書の同期が取れていないことを示唆しています。

実装状況の詳細：
- 21関数が完了
- ユーティリティ関数も実装済み
- テストケース10個存在

検証の課題：
- ANSI準拠率の確認が不十分
- Wasmコンパイル対応が部分的

最終的な評価は「INCOMPLETE」となり、文書の更新と完全な検証が必要です。

file.content:
;;;; count-test.lisp - Unit tests for count sequence functions
;;;; Feature: 001-ansi-sequence-functions (Phase 15B)
;;;; User Story 1: Element Counting Functions (Priority: P1)
;;;;
;;;; HyperSpec: [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm)
;;;;
;;;; TDD: Write tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation

(in-package #:clysm/tests/unit/sequences/count)

;;; ============================================================
;;; T011: count* Basic Functionality Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-basic-list
  "Test count* on list"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 2 1 3 1 4)) 3)
      "count 1 in (1 2 1 3 1 4) should return 3"))

(deftest count-basic-vector
  "Test count* on vector"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'b #(a b c b d b)) 3)
      "count b in #(a b c b d b) should return 3"))

(deftest count-basic-string
  "Test count* on string"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* #\l "hello") 2)
      "count #\\l in \"hello\" should return 2"))

(deftest count-not-found
  "Test count* when element not found"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'z '(a b c d)) 0)
      "count z in (a b c d) should return 0"))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T012: count* with :key Keyword Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-with-key-car
  "Test count* with :key #'car"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'a '((a 1) (b 2) (a 3)) :key #'car) 2)
      "count a in alist by car should return 2"))

(deftest count-with-key-cadr
  "Test count* with :key #'cadr"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 2 '((a 1) (b 2) (c 2)) :key #'cadr) 2)
      "count 2 in alist by cadr should return 2"))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T013: count* with :test Keyword Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-with-test-equal
  "Test count* with :test #'equal"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* "hello" '("hello" "world" "hello") :test #'equal) 2)
      "count \"hello\" with equal should return 2"))

(deftest count-with-test-string-equal
  "Test count* with :test #'string-equal (case-insensitive)"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* "HELLO" '("hello" "world" "HELLO") :test #'string-equal) 2)
      "count case-insensitive should return 2"))

(deftest count-with-test-eq
  "Test count* with :test #'eq"
  (let ((sym 'foo))
    (ok (= (clysm::count* sym (list sym 'bar sym) :test #'eq) 2)
        "count with eq should find identical symbols")))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T014: count* with :start/:end Bounds Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-with-start
  "Test count* with :start"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 1 1 1 1) :start 2) 3)
      "count 1 starting from index 2 should return 3"))

(deftest count-with-end
  "Test count* with :end"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 1 1 1 1) :end 3) 3)
      "count 1 ending at index 3 should return 3"))

(deftest count-with-start-end
  "Test count* with both :start and :end"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 2 1 2 1 2 1) :start 1 :end 5) 2)
      "count 1 in range [1,5) should return 2"))

(deftest count-with-start-end-list
  "Test count-if with :start/:end per spec"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'evenp '(1 2 3 4 5) :start 1 :end 4) 2)
      "count-if evenp in [1,4) should return 2 (elements: 2, 4)"))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T015: count* with :from-end Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-from-end-no-effect
  "Test count* with :from-end (should not affect count)"
  ;; :from-end doesn't affect count since we're just counting
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 2 1 3 1) :from-end t) 3)
      "count with :from-end should still return 3"))

(deftest count-from-end-with-bounds
  "Test count* :from-end with bounds"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 2 1 3 1 4 1) :start 1 :end 5 :from-end t) 2)
      "count in range [1,5) with :from-end should return 2"))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T016: count-if* and count-if-not* Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-if-evenp
  "Test count-if* with evenp"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'evenp '(1 2 3 4 5)) 2)
      "count-if evenp should return 2"))

(deftest count-if-oddp
  "Test count-if* with oddp"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'oddp '(1 2 3 4 5)) 3)
      "count-if oddp should return 3"))

(deftest count-if-not-evenp
  "Test count-if-not* with evenp"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if-not* #'evenp '(1 2 3 4 5)) 3)
      "count-if-not evenp should return 3"))

(deftest count-if-not-oddp
  "Test count-if-not* with oddp"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if-not* #'oddp '(1 2 3 4 5)) 2)
      "count-if-not oddp should return 2"))

(deftest count-if-with-key
  "Test count-if* with :key"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'evenp '((a 1) (b 2) (c 3) (d 4)) :key #'cadr) 2)
      "count-if evenp on cadr should return 2"))

(deftest count-if-string
  "Test count-if* on string"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'upper-case-p "Hello World") 2)
      "count-if upper-case-p should return 2"))

(deftest count-if-vector
  "Test count-if* on vector"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'numberp #(1 a 2 b 3)) 3)
      "count-if numberp in vector should return 3"))

;;; ============================================================
;;; T017: Edge Case Tests
;;; ============================================================

(deftest count-empty-list
  "Test count* on empty list"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'x '()) 0)
      "count in empty list should return 0"))

(deftest count-empty-vector
  "Test count* on empty vector"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'x #()) 0)
      "count in empty vector should return 0"))

(deftest count-empty-string
  "Test count* on empty string"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* #\x "") 0)
      "count in empty string should return 0"))

(deftest count-start-equals-end
  "Test count* when start equals end"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 1 1) :start 1 :end 1) 0)
      "count with start=end should return 0 (empty range)"))

(deftest count-if-empty-list
  "Test count-if* on empty list"
  (ok (= (clysm::count-if* #'evenp '()) 0)
      "count-if on empty list should return 0"))

(deftest count-all-match
  "Test count* when all elements match"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 1 '(1 1 1 1 1)) 5)
      "count 1 in (1 1 1 1 1) should return 5"))

(deftest count-none-match
  "Test count* when no elements match"
  (ok (= (clysm::count* 'z '(a b c d e)) 0)
      "count z in (a b c d e) should return 0"))

テストファイルは存在し、テストが書かれています。しかし、tasks.mdのタスクはすべて未チェック（[ ]）のままになっています。実際のコードは実装されているようですが、tasks.mdが更新されていないようです。

また、ANSI準拠率60%+という検証基準を確認する必要があります。これはANSIテストスイートを実行して確認する必要がありますが、テスト実行中にエラーが発生しています。

現在のステータスをまとめると：1. ホスト側実装（sequences.lisp）：21関数すべて実装済み
2. テストファイル：10個すべて存在
3. Wasmコンパイル対応：8関数（count, count-if, find, find-if, position, position-if, substitute, substitute-if）
4. ANSI準拠率確認：テスト実行エラーのため未確認

tasks.mdは更新されていないが、実装は完了しているようです。検証基準の「sequences カテゴリ 60%+ パス」を確認できていません。Phase 15Bの検証基準を見ると：- 検索関数 (count, position, find) 完全実装 → 一部完了（ホスト側完了、Wasm対応一部）
- 置換関数 (substitute, replace) → 一部完了（substitute完了、replace未対応）
- 重複削除 (remove-duplicates, delete-duplicates) → ホスト側完了、Wasm未対応- 比較関数 (mismatch, search) → ホスト側完了、Wasm未対応「完全実装」の定義が不明確です。

Wasmへの対応範囲について、コミットログは Phase 15B の実装を示していますが、具体的な要件が曖昧です。ホスト側の実装は完了しているものの、Wasm対応の詳細な範囲が不透明な状況です。タスクの完了基準を明確にする必要があります。

コンパイラへの組み込みは部分的で、ANSI準拠率の検証が未完了。60%以上の準拠率を満たしているか確認できていないため、現時点では不完全な状態と判断すべきでしょう。

implementation-plan.mdの検証基準で重要なのは：

Phase 15の検証基準：
- [ ] `(count 1 '(1 2 1 3 1))` => 3
- [ ] `(intersection '(1 2 3) '(2 3 4))` => (2 3) or (3 2)  (Phase 15A)
- [ ] `(remove-duplicates '(a b a c b))` => (A B C) or equivalent
- [ ] sequences カテゴリ 60%+ パス
- [ ] cons カテゴリ 50%+ パス

spec.mdのSC-001：
> SC-001: ANSI CL sequences category test compliance rate reaches 60% or higher

これは明確に未検証です。tasks.mdのタスクT096も：
> - [ ] T096 Verify 60%+ ANSI sequences compliance (SC-001)

となっています。

したがって、検証基準「sequences カテゴリ 60%+ パス」が満たされているか確認できていないため、INCOMPLETEです。
